intro: Scabiosa crenata var. nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra Skyrocket, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
